Nvidia closes $700 mln Run:ai acquisition after regulatory hurdles
item.description:
Chipmaker Nvidia has completed its acquisition of Israeli AI firm Run:ai, the startup said on Monday, following antitrust scrutiny over the buyout.

item.title: UBS boss warns against excessive banking regulation ahead of overhaul
item.description:
Switzerland should not set rules for its banking sector that put it at a disadvantage, UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti was quoted as saying on Monday, as the country prepares to overhaul regulation following his bank's takeover of Credit Suisse.

Reuters Business

item.title: Where have you been?
item.description:
It’s been a while since you’ve opened one of our newsletters.Hello! It’s been a while since you’ve opened Reuters Weekend Briefing. The newsletter is designed to provide you with a recap of the stories you may have missed each week. Our world-renowned journalists work hard to keep you informed with comprehensive coverage delivered right to your inbox. If you read the newsletter and believe you have received this message by mistake, you may have images turned off when viewing emails from Reuters. To continue receiving the newsletter, we recommend that you turn images on. In the meantime, review our other newsletter offerings, covering topics such as the business of sustainability, the automotive industry, and power and energy. Thank you for reading Reuters Weekend Briefing. Sincerely, The Reuters Newsletter Team Want to stop receiving this email? Unsubscribe here.To manage which newsletters you're subscribed to, click here.

item.title: AT&T, Verizon targeted by Salt Typhoon cyberespionage operation, but networks secure
item.description:
The Chinese-linked Salt Typhoon cyberespionage operation targeted AT&T and Verizon's systems, but the wireless carriers' U.S. networks are now secure as they work with law enforcement and government officials, the companies said on Saturday.
Sign up for Reuters newsletters Technology Roundup Technology Roundup

Bezos' Blue Origin gets FAA license for its first New Glenn rocket launch
Why OpenAI plans transition to public benefit corporation
US adds 9th telcom to list of companies hacked by Chinese-backed Salt Typhoon cyberespionage
Biden administration proposes new cybersecurity rules to limit impact of healthcare data leaks
Hackers hijack a wide range of companies' Chrome extensions, experts say
OpenAI outlines new for-profit structure in bid to stay ahead in costly AI race

item.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to pause law that could ban TikTok
item.description:
President-elect Donald Trump has urged the U.S. Supreme Court to pause implementation of a law that would ban popular social media app TikTok or force its sale, arguing he should have time after taking office to pursue a "political resolution" to the issue.

item.title: OpenAI outlines new for-profit structure to stay ahead in costly AI race
item.description:
OpenAI on Friday outlined plans to revamp its structure, saying it would create a public benefit corporation that would make it easier to raise capital and remove the restrictions imposed on the startup by its current nonprofit parent.

item.title: BioNTech enters settlement with US agency, UPenn over COVID vaccine royalties
item.description:
BioNTech has entered into two separate settlement agreements with the U.S. National Institutes of Health and the University of Pennyslvania over the payment of royalties related to its COVID-19 vaccine, the company said in filings on Friday.

item.title: Court orders recall of Signify lighting products over patents, Seoul Semiconductor says
item.description:
A German court has ordered the recall and destruction of some products from lighting maker Signify that infringed on the patents of Seoul Semiconductor , the South Korean firm said on Thursday.

item.title: US holiday retail sales stronger than last year with online boost, Mastercard says
item.description:
U.S. retail sales rose 3.8% between Nov. 1 and Dec. 24, as intense promotion to drum up sales in what was expected to be a highly competitive holiday season for retailers prompted last-minute shopping among consumers.

item.title: NASA spacecraft attempts closest-ever approach to the sun
item.description:
NASA's Parker Solar Probe was expected to make history on Tuesday by flying into the sun's outer atmosphere called the corona on a mission to help scientists learn more about Earth's closest star.
